meanings.sent1: The heavy chains acted as a trammel to his escape.
meanings.sent2: The thick fog was a trammel to their progress through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The tangled vines created a trammel for the curious explorer.
meanings.sent4: Fear can be a trammel that holds us back from reaching our goals.
meanings.sent5: The locked door was a trammel preventing entry into the mysterious room.

meanings.definition: A fishing net with three layers
meanings.sent1: The fishermen cast the trammel into the deep waters.
meanings.sent2: The trammel was heavy with the day's catch of fish.
meanings.sent3: The trammel glistened in the sunlight as it was pulled aboard.
meanings.sent4: The trammel swayed gently in the ocean currents, awaiting its next haul.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the trammel ensured a bountiful harvest for the fishermen.

meanings.sent1: She felt trammelled by the strict rules of the school.
meanings.sent2: The fence trammelled the movement of the curious puppy.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to escape were trammelled by the thick mud.
meanings.sent4: The paperwork trammelled her ability to focus on more important tasks.
meanings.sent5: The heavy workload trammelled his creativity and innovation.

meanings.definition: A metal frame for holding a pot over a fire
meanings.sent1: The trammel swung over the crackling flames, cooking the stew.
meanings.sent2: The chef adjusted the height of the trammel to control the heat.
meanings.sent3: The trammel clanked as it was moved to a different position over the fire.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the stew filled the room as it simmered on the trammel.
meanings.sent5: The trammel's sturdy construction ensured the pot remained steady over the fire.
